column1: skidding through on middle, Roy stretches out and pushes it back to Green
slower and shorter, picked off the thigh through the vacant spaces at midwicket
darted short and wide outside off, Hughes steps back and cracks it straight to backward point
sliding into the pads, clipped away wide of midwicket for one
on a length on middle, tight lines, played up to the covers
the new ball skids on middle, Hughes presses forward and punchily drives to long-on
back of a length and outside off, Hughes stays leg-side of the ball and punches between backward point and cover point
Hughes hits the first boundary of this season's BBL. Length ball, shapes in slightly, he picks it up with the wrists and sends the ball whistling over square leg
this is even better! He sends the ball soaring over the midwicket boundary. Short and outside off, swivels on the back foot and nails a pull. Bam
pitched further up and angling across off, forward and driven through the line to extra cover
full and wide outside off, Hughes carts another one through the line but can't find the off-side gap
Fekete finds extra bounce and beats the edge. This one rears up from a good length outside off and zips over the indecisive waft of Hughes. Good end to the over
and what a start! He sends it screaming past the outside edge. Good length, angling away, seaming away past the loose prod

McClenaghan has Roy spooning a catch to cover point. Good length, angling away, and seaming away outside off. Roy attempts a leg-side flick despite being squared up. Instead, he leading-edges it to Gibson. A distraught Roy inspects the pitch and trots off. England players continue to have a wretched time in Australia
finds the leading edge again. This looks like a slower cutter, wafted back to the bowler as Maddinson plays early. Rolls back to the bowler
very full and attacking the off stump, Maddinson prods forward and inside-edges it back to the bowler. Mitch threatening all edges
Maddinson rides the bounce of this short ball outside off, softens his grip, and guides to cover
back of a length and outside off, opens the face and jabs it away to deep third man
darted short on middle, Maddinson steps away outside leg and creams a cut over backward point. The ball whistles away to the boundary
Maddinson tends to stay leg-side of the ball, this is arrowed in at leg stump, played back to the bowler
Maddinson makes room outside leg and lifts it with the break over wide mid-off. So easy on the eye
quicker offbreak, shorter and outside off, he forces at the ball and manages an inside edge onto the pad
leg-stump full-toss, glanced away square of short fine leg. Maddinson simply gave it direction
tossed up higher and dips on leg stump, chipped in the air but does not carry to mid-on
pitched up and outside off, lashed through the line but straight to backward point
overpitched and outside off, forward and belted to the left of mid-off. Patterson takes his eyes off the ball and fumbles, missing a run-out chance
Maddinson shows his ace early - he backs away outside leg - the bowler spots it and gets this cutter to stick in the surface and fool the moving batsman
dug in shorter and outside off, nice change-up from Mitch. Drags a thick inside edge down to long leg
loopy slower delivery, drifts down leg, 110ks, the batsman flicks early.... and misses. Leg-side wide
chest-hunting short ball on middle, rushes Hughes for pace. He dares to hook and sends a top edge flying over short fine leg
pitched up and outside off, Hughes stretches out and crunnnnnnnches it but straight to extra cover
Maddinson greets Watson with a six down the ground. Good length and angling away outside off, loose ball, he stretches out and thumps it into the sightscreen
back of a length and aiming for the top of off, a strong punch to mid-off intervenes
full and wide outside off, Maddinson marches down the track, takes the half-volley and carts it over extra cover
full leg-side ball, simply tickled away fine. He picked the slower ball and deflected it fine of short fine leg
overpitched and outside off, Watson escapes punishment as he is hit straight down to mid-off
Maddinson makes swinging room and sashays down the pitch. Watson is wary of it as he pulls his length back and follows him like a stalker. Forces him to push it quietly to mid-off
back of a length on middle, played back to Ahmed
tossed up on off and breaks away, googly? defended to cover

Fawad arrives and breaks the promising stand. This was the turning legbreak, pitches on off and middle and breaks back in, coaxing the batsman to play around his front pad and miss the ball. The leg stump is under threat and Maddinson is gone
Henriques stretches out to defend this tossed-up ball on off
Henriques uses his feet and drills a drive back to the bowler
Fawad caps a wicket maiden. That's gold dust in T20. Short legbreak, turns outside off, stabbed back to him off the back foot
good length and angling across off from over the stumps, dabbed down to third man
Henriques rides the bounce of this short ball outside off and glides it off the face to the left of backward point
very full and straight, twirls his wrists and whips it strongly to the right of deep square leg
hip-high short ball on off stump, Hughes steps back and swats it out to deep square leg. Excellent wristwork again
picked off the hips to long leg for a couple of runs
short, wide, slashed to backward point
short, wide, googly, breaks past the ambitious flash outside off
skidding across off, lovely dip, beats the outside edge edge
tip and run to cover. First runs off Fawad after nine balls
Henriques dashes down the track, meets it on the half-volley and smashes it back to the bowler. Fawad tips it down the ground
dropped shorter and outside off, cracked to sweeper cover off the back foot
straight ball on off, he pushes it into the vacant spaces at cover
that's outta here! Henriques soars down the track, meets an off-stump full-toss and smacks it into the stands beyond midwicket. Huge hit
Henriques now uses his feet and goes over extra cover

Henriques targets the midwicket boundary, again, this time with a slog sweep. But Nair gets it to break in and bounce and foil the shot. He skies it in the air. Watson and the keeper converge behind the wicket. The Thunder captain calls for it and snaffles the top edge
pushed through on middle, stabbed down the ground off an inside edge

Buttler breaks the bails off and seems very confident. This is really full and skidding across off from over the wicket, Hughes flashes and only connects with a whole lot of thin air. After being overbalanced, he looks to drag his back foot inside the crease. The toe is on the line by the time the keeper breaks the bails. This looks very close to me but there is nothing behind the line. Hughes has already started to walk off. He has been asked to return: not out. Benefit of the doubt going to the batsman? This was really tight, though. In fact, it looked out to me because there was nothing behind the line. Well, this dismissal takes the mind back to Moeen's dismissal in the Ashes #wobblyline
shorter and angling away outside off, flashes again and cuts behind point
full and sliding away just outside off, he attempts a slog-sweep.... and misses
very full and straying into the pads, duly clipped out to deep midwicket
down the track and clipped against the break to deep midwicket
tossed up outside off, good drop in pace, forced back to Fawad

Thunder have their man now. Fawad has Hughes holing out to long-off. Good length on off, not much turn, Hughes stays leg-side of the ball and aims to loft it over the man in the deep. He does not middle it and winds up chipping a catch to the sub fielder
down the track and scooped to sweeper cover
full and slides on outside off, tapped down to long-off
shorter and outside off, carrom ball? Stabbed back to the bowler
carrom ball outside off, pushed to the covers again
Nair sends back Botha for a duck. Full, turning offbreak, sharp spin for Nair. Botha plays across the line and misses it by a long way. He has been pinned plumb in front
good length on the stumps, pushed back to the bowler
down the track and punched down to long-on for a single
driven through the line to cover. This was a tossed-up ball outside off
short and outside leg, Billings whips it firmly to deep square leg
good length and straight in line, clipped away to deep square off the back foot
tossed on middle, nips down the track and drives crisply to long-on
biting legbreak, pitches on off and nibbles away to catch the pad
lobbed up outside off, forays down the track and drives to cover. What a spell from Fawad: 4-1-11-2 with 13 dots
shortish and outside off, forced to the right of the bowler off the back foot
tossed outside off, Billings ventures across off and cracks a reverse-sweep through backward point
He attempts the reverse again and finds the same result. Floated outside off, he stretches out and lifts a reverse sweep to the left of sweeper cover. Such fast hands from Billings
Billings now forays down the track, meets the pitch of this offbreak, and secures a single down to long-on

down the track and whipped with the break to short midwicket. There's a mix-up, a direct hit could have had Nevill. Butter grabs the ball and aims to pop it back onto the stumps like Dhoni often does. But by the time he pulls that off the batsman is in
fuller and outside off, stabbed back to Nair
Billings slinks away outside leg, the bowler follows him, short-armed away to long-on
dropped short on middle, Nevill swivels on the back foot and places it beautifully between deep square leg and wide long-on. How deep he went inside the crease for that pull
good length and sliding across off, that's forced away to the off-side sweeper
Billings clears Blizzard at deep midwicket. The fielder seems to have misjudged it by nipping in as opposed to scooping back towards the boundary. He can only watch this loft sail over him
down the track and hit down the ground
tossed up and angling across off, carved down to long-off
tossed on off, Nevill goes low and scoops it over the keeper's head
down the track, but too close to the pitch, and ends up dragging it past the non-striker to long-on
full on middle, down the track and thrashed back to the bowler, the ball bursts through his hands
tossed higher and slower outside off, Nevill steps out but again gets too close to the pitch, and chips to long-off

The throw hits Buttler on the top of the helmet! Ouch. Down the track, the bowler dragged it short, hacked away to deep square leg off a thick inside edge. The throw bounces up and pings the lid. Buttler needs medical attention, he sips some drinks, and seems okay
uses his feet and works with the break to wide long-on. They hare across for the second

Fekete returns and has Nevill nicking behind. Back of a length and rears up outside off, Nevill flashes and feathers it to Buttler, who scoops his arms above the shoulder and catches it. Nevill never really got going
back of a length and outside off, tapped to the covers
length ball on off stump, O'Keefe clears his front leg and has a big yahoo at it. He ends up dragging this slower ball to the midwicket boundary

dug in short and outside off, he gets on top of the bounce and pulls it, tennis-style, to the midwicket boundary. That's a no-ball as well. Fekete did a Finn - knocking off the bails in his followthrough
full on off, opens up his hips, and smacks it to wide long-on
back of a length on middle, Billings stays leg-side of the ball and eases it to deep point
full slower ball, Billings has a big heavo-ho and misses. That's only the second dot he has played out
good length and outside off, O'Keefe uses the angle and dabs down to deep third man
Billings moves away outside leg, Mitch attacks the body, fended off square on the off side
full and angling across off, O'Keefe frees his arms and crunches it to the off-side sweeper
slower, short ball, begs on its knees to be smashed. O'Keefe obliges, he rocks back and flat-bats it between deep midwicket and long-on
forward and stabbed past the right of the bowler to long-on
short and angling away outside off, Billings slaps it down to long-off
Billings dashes down the track and misses this full ball that slants away outside off
leg-stump yorker, jammed out to deep square leg. The throw from the deep isn't accurate. Buttler, however, gathers the ball and takes the bails off to catch Billings short on the second
bouncer down leg, ducks under, too high and that's a wide
another yorker on leg stump, the batsman, having backed away, digs it out to the covers
pretty full on middle, chipped in the air.... but does not carry to Patterson at long-on
very full on middle, punched down to wide long-on
short and aimed at the body, this is a half-fend, half-swat to long leg
O'Keefe ventures a fair way across off, he eyes up a scoop against the angle from over the wicket. Beaten
back of a length and zipping away outside off, O'Keefe has an almighty slog at it but loses his shape and does not make contact
short, slower cutter, another one that beats the leg-side hoick

Green judges it well and takes the catch smartly at the edge of the short wide long-on boundary. Dug in shorter outside off, rushes the batsman for pace. He splices the pull to Green. Wicket no. 2 for Mitch McClenaghan on BBL debut
back of a length and outside off, Abbott picks the offcutter, waits for it to arrive. Then ferociously flat-bats it between deep midwicket and wide long-on

slower full-toss outside off, dragged across the line between deep midwicket and wide long-on. They chance a second. The throw from the deep is to the keeper's end. Buttler takes the ball on the half-volley and whips the bails off to catch Abbott short on the second
really full and slanting in from over the wicket, whippy quick-arm action, jabbed to short midwicket
on a length and outside off, punched on the up to extra cover
short and tucks the batsman up for room. Patterson hops and gets a single behind square
bouncer, angling away outside off, ducks under it
pretty full on off stump, stroked back to the bowler

Sams strikes in his first over on T20 debut! And what a wicket that is: Jos Buttler. Good change-up, this. Offcutter, good length, bounces and sticks in the surface. Buttler chips it into the night sky. The bowler himself settles under it
arrowed into the pads, whipped up to deep midwicket
good length and drifts in to rap the front pad of Watson as he plays down the wrong line
shortish and outside off, chopped away wide of backward point. The fielder dives and half(stops) the ball
fired onto the pads again, punched off the back foot to midwicket
uses his feet, picks it off the pads, and flicks to deep midwicket
no-ball, skidding through outside off, keeps low, punched to mid-off
Watson attacks the free-hit ball and drags it off the inside half past the right of long-on
full and outside off, forward and driven through the line to extra cover
back of a length and angling down the leg side, wide
slower cutter outside off, Patterson throws his bat at the ball. Looks for an expansive on-the-up drive and ends up dragging this offcutter past leg stump
really full on off, jabbed down to mid-off
length ball on off, driven on the up to cover
full and hung up really wide outside off, Patterson's front foot is nowhere near the pitch of the ball. He flashes and misses wildly
another slower cutter, breaks back in, Patterson jabs at it and nearly plays on again. The ball rolls past the leg stump to the fine-leg boundary
back of a length and skids on middle, fended back to him
Watson plants Bollinger into the stands beyond midwicket. Shorter and angling away outside off, gets on top of the bounce and crunnnnnches a pull. Watson at his best
Watson rides the bounce of this back-of-a-length ball and secures a single down to third man
back of a length and holds its line outside off, beats the outside edge as Patterson hangs his bat out in the corridor
back of a length and outside off, Patterson responds with a crisp punch through cover
another push into the gap at cover
back of a length and angling across off, swished through the covers, Moises makes an excellent tumbling save to his left

There's a direct hit at the bowler's end, putting Patterson is trouble. But he has slid his bat in, beating Botha's direct hit. Stands up tall to this shortish ball outside off, forces to mid-off, and sets off
short, rising ball on off, Watson rises with it and fends it back to the bowler
back of a length and outside off, Watson opens the face and punches to deep third man
very full and cutting away outside off, beaten past the outside edge as he aims a biiiig drive and misses
hip-high short ball on off, pulled off the back foot to deep midwicket
short and zips off the deck, beating the batsman who was backing away for a hook
full and outside off, punched on the up to mid-off
back of a length on off, turned straight to midwicket
whipped from the hips to deep midwicket
good length and angling down the leg side, past the leg glance, wide
short of a length, skidding off the pitch, to ping the thigh
142ks length ball outside off, Watson stretches out, takes it on the up, and belts a drive past the right of the bowler and to the left of mid-on. Watson showing he still has it
flat dart, sliding across off, swished to sweeper cover
drifts in on middle and leg, milked in front of square leg for a rapid single
flat and slow, down the track and whipped to deep midwicket
dragged down on off stump, Watson hangs back and pulls it off the inside half to deep midwicket
skidding in to catch the pad and roll behind square
back of a length and on the hips, swatted off the back foot to deep square leg
slid through on middle from around the wicket, played back to the bowler
back of a length on middle, back-foot punch to the left of mid-on
tossed up on the leg stump, very full, Watson gets underneath the length and smokes it over the short long-on boundary
skidding through on middle, fast fizzer, defended back
short of a length on middle, short-arm pull to deep midwicket
speared in, 94ks, whipped off the hips to deep midwicket
flat dart angling across off, Kurtis slog-sweeps and does not make contact
keeps it flat, angling across off, Kurtis uses his feet and punches up to long-on
low full-toss outside off, driven off the front foot to long-off
dropped short and wide outside off, flat-batted to wide long-off
fired on middle, shortish, Watson rocks back and flat-bats it right past the bowler

Watson attacks the short, straight boundary and fetches another six. Tossed up on a length outside off, he lofts it against the intended break over the long-on fielder. That's outta here, and we need to find a new ball
Kurtis stays leg-side of this quick dart outside off, and flays it down to long-off
short and outside leg, Watson shuffles across off, lines it up and pulls it to the fine-leg boundary; one-bounce four
short and aiming for the top of the stumps, Watson camps back and punches back to the bowler
not as short but the trajectory is flat and angling across off, past the cut
on a length and outside off, drilled down to long-off off the front foot
on a length and outside off, cracked off the back foot to long-off
slower, short ball outside off, checks his pull and sends the ball to deep square leg
clipped off the hips to deep square leg
pitched up and outside off, belted through the line but straight to mid-off
just short of a good length and outside off, Watson keeps lining 'em up and pulling to deep midwicket
dug short and outside off, pulled around the corner
back of a length, angling in, straightens away, poked to point

Sams returns and breaches through the defences of Paterson. Slower cutter, breaks back in sharply, storms through the gate. Pitches outside off and hits the top of leg stump - that was how special it was
another slower cutter, breaks in, check-pushed to cover
just short of a good length and outside off, swatted to deep midwicket
full and outside off, tapped into the covers
slower short ball outside off, 117ks, this is more a short-arm flap than a short-arm pull. Miscued to the right of midwicket
good length and skidding in at off, Rohrer jams his bat down on the ball
seam-up, short on off, pulled straight to deep midwicket
too straight in line, whipped square of long leg for a double
on a length and holds its line outside off, faster one, Rohrer uses the pace of the bowler. Opens the face and guides it to the right of a tumbling backward point

Good drop in pace, a bit more overspin. Roher aims to clip it away on the leg side against the break. But he is nowhere close to the pitch and closes the face of the bat early. He winds up scooping a leading edge to short cover
works this offbreak with the turn to the right of square leg
seam-up ball, back of a length and outside off, flayed on the up to cover
slower through the air and drifts in on middle, forward defensive
drifts in at off, grips and breaks away, dabbed with the turn to point
opens the face again but can't get it past point
tossed outside off, played to cover. Four dots in a row
dangled up outside off, scoops a drive to long-off
dropped short and wide outside off, chopped to sweeper. Just two off the over

Watson clears the short straight boundary. He hits it straight of long-on and brings up his fourth fifty in the BBL. Good length ball on off and middle, he simply punches it on the up and clears Botha
shorter on off, opens the face and manipulates it wide of Roy at backward point
short and banged in at the chest, Watson flaps a pull to deep backward square leg
back of a length and attacking the body, bunted into the vacant spaces at midwicket. Bollinger's front foot has strayed
wide yorker, Gibson can't jam his bat down in time
short and darted in on middle, chopped behind the wicket for one
that's a ripaaaaaah from Bollinger! He ventures wide of the crease and gets it to angle in at Watson, then cunningly seam away past the outside edge. Unplayable
quicker offbreak, finishes on middle, stabbed back to Botha
floated up on middle, he stays leg side of the ball and drives to cover. He simply can't find the gap or go over the top
down the track and clipped out to deep midwicket
seam-up short ball outside off. Watson sizes it up and tonks it off the back foot over the midwicket boundary. Smashing pull
back of a length on off, sliced out to the right of point
down the track, gets too close to the pitch, and clips to long-on
Gibson uses his feet, Abbott beats the inside edge and pings the pad of the batsman
rising short ball outside off, deflected fine past the keeper. Okay, he's got Watson back on strike
just short of a good length on off stump, Watson can knock these runs on his own. He nails a pull into the stands beyond midwicket
goes for the yorker, but this comes out as a full-toss on the off stump, whipped away between deep square leg and deep midwicket
bouncer outside off, bursts off the deck, left alone. Wide
slower legcutter outside off, but the length is short. Watson leans back and carves it over backward point
full-toss, angling into hit the pad, but this is clearly heading past leg stump
slower full ball outside off, 115ks, opens the face and slices through point
wide yorker, angling away outside off, Watson can't touch it
back of a length offcutter, slid down to third man
O'Keefe runs in from long leg, dives forward, and holds onto this top edge. Rushing short ball on middle, Gibson's scratchy innings ends. He hooks but only skies it to O'Keefe

What a debut this is turning out to be for Sams! Two in two this over, including the big scalp of Watson. Back of a length and angling across off, Watson punches crisply but picks out Henriques at cover
a big shout for lbw, but this is perhaps heading down the leg side. Pretty full and nipping in, the batsman plays around the front pad and misses. Sams finishes with 4 for 14 on T20 debut
full-toss on off stump, clubbed across the line to the midwicket boundary
just short of a good length and outside off, short-armed over midwicket
full and attacking the stumps, pushed down the ground to long-on
back of a length and bouncing over the stumps as the batsman has a big yahoo at it and misses
middle-stump yorker, toe-ended down to long-on
down the track and carved to extra cover
wide full-toss, Nair stays leg-side of the ball and carves it away past the right of deep third man for four. Perfect start to the over for Thunder
banged in short and outside off, Nair has a crack at a pull and top-edges it, but gets the desired result. Edged past the keeper for another boundary
really full on the leg stump, whipped away to wide long-on
Blizzard squirts a boundary to the right of Bollinger. Lazy work from the big man at 45. He was too lazy to dive. Very full on leg stump nudged away
full-toss on the leg stump, clipped away to deep square leg

back of a length and outside off, Nair reaches out for the ball with fast hands and carves it to cover point. Nair and Blizzard hare across for a single to seal Thunder's win. Botha at cover-point did not attack the ball and simply hung back. He could not effect a direct hit either. The throw is to Abbott, and Nair dishes out a full-length dive to wrap it up. Replays suggest the ball bobbled out of Abbott's hands. Gee, what a finish
